intro: Mucronea californica, commonly known as the California mucronate, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is found in coastal and inland areas of California. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
